Among the many who so nobly and gallantly braved death in that battle, there was none more noble and gallant than him to whose memory this tribute is offered.
His love and devotion to his native State caused him to volunteer among the first for the defence of her soil.

When he fell, his comrades gathered around him to bear him from the field, and while in the arms of one his noble spirit took its flight.
Thus has fallen another patriot and hero, as a sacrifice upon the altar of his country.
He was a true friend and faithful soldier, and merited by his many kind and amiable qualities, the esteem and admiration of all who knew him.

When at home, he was idolized by his friends, and was the loved and cherished son of a widowed mother, whose heart is now torn and lacerated because of the sad bereavement.--She is called upon to mourn the loss of one that would have soothed and comforted her during her declining years, and a void is left never again to be filled on earth.
But let it be comfort and consolation to his relatives and friends to know that his many good qualities in life, and noble, heroic death, shall remain forever inscribed upon tablets of enduring memory. [*] W. H. G.

div3.head: Headq'rs 1st Va. Regiment, Cary St., June 19, 1862.
div3.p:
Wanted — Recruits.--This regiment is now at its quarters, actively engaged in filling up its ranks, which had been much reduced by a severe and long campaign.
All persons desirous of joining the regiment will apply at the old stand of Gray & Adams, on Cary street. They will be accorded the privilege of connecting themselves with any company in the regiment.
div3.closer: je 20--6t* J. W. Tabb, Capt. Com'g.

div3.head: Thirty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--I will give the above reward for the apprehension and delivery to me, at the camp of the 7th South Carolina regiment, near Richmond, of Patrick Ryan, a member of my company.
Said Patrick Ryan is about 23 years of age; 5 feet 8 or 10 inches high; fair skin; blue eyes, and auburn hair, and an Irishman by birth.
He was mustered into my company, as a substitute, on the 15th instant, and left on the 19th.
He originally belonged to Company B, 1st Maryland regiment.
div3.closer:
Benj. Roper.
je 20--3t* Capt. Co. 1, 7th S. C. Reg't.

div3.head: Attention, Richmond Light guard.
div3.p:
--Members of this company will report promptly at the office of Wm.
Wallace Sons, on 13th between Main and Cary streets, at 11 o'clock, 26th June, to receive their pay and commutation for rations.
Any member failing to report promptly will have to wait until next pay, 31st August.
div3.closer:
G. A. Wallace.
je 20--3t Captain Company.

div3.head:
Hdq'rs 14th Georgia Reg't,
June 16, 1862.
div3.p:
the under-named members of the 14th Georgia Regiment, viz: William J. Tanner, A. S. Tanner, and A. J. Reynolds, having left for parts unknown.
I take this method of notifying them to report forthwith to the officer in command of said regiment, or they will be dealt with as deserters.
div3.closer:
Jas. M. Fielder,
je 20--4t* Capt. Co, D, 14th Ga. Reg't.

div3.head: Notice.--Marylanders, Fall in!
div3.p:
--I leave for headquarters, at Staunton, Tuesday morning. I am recruiting for the First Maryland Line, and my office is over Brotherton's store, corner of Main and 14th sts. Those who wish to join our gallant band have now the best chance offered.
Fall in, men, and help to snatch your State from the hands of the enemy.
div3.closer:
Jas. Mullen, Lieut.
je 20--1t* First Maryland Line.

div3.head:
Banner Hospital.
June 19th, 1862.
div3.p:
all out-patients registered at this Hospital, must report immediately at the Hospital, or they will be reported as deserters.
Office hours from 10 to 1 o'clock.
div3.closer:
Wm. Alex. Thom.
je 20--3t* Surgeon in charge.

div3.head: Attention!
div3.p: --All absentees from my company, who do not report in person, or furnish at the headquarters of this regiment a certificate of disability from some regularly appointed army surgeon, before the 22d day of June, will then be advertised as deserters, and a reward offered for their immediate apprehension.

It is hoped that there is no member of this company so lost to a sense of honor and manly pride, as to bring disgrace upon himself, and be a reproach forever to his family and friends.
But appeals to patriotism, in some instances, have been made in vain: kind words have failed to produce their intended effect; moderation has ceased to be a virtue; and duty to our country, duty to the brave men who are still at their post of danger, and who have boldly confronted the foe at Manassas, Williamsburg and Seven Pines, and duty to the friends and relatives of the brave men that have fallen in defence of their homes and their liberties, requires and demands that some sterner steps should be taken, and that the cowards who have ever deserted us in the hour of peril should be brought to justice, and punished as they deserve.
div3.closer:
H. T. Owen.
je 19--2t* Capt. Co. C, 18th Reg't Va. Vols.

div3.head: Charlotte cavalry.
div3.p:
--The Charlotte cavalry, having at this time only sixty-three, rank and file, Seventeen Recruits are desired to fill it up to the maximum number.
This company is one of the best armed companies in the service, being armed with Merril's Carbine, Colt's Navy Pistol, and Sabres.
I have at my disposal enough arms of the above kind to arm quite a number of recruits, which will be distributed to them as they join this company.
Recruits wishing to join us will equip themselves, and report to me in camp, near the Greenbrier White Sulphur, where arms will be furnished them.
Further information can be had of Mr. Wm. G. Friend, near Drake's Branch, Charlotte county, Va., who is requested to act as Recruiting Agent for the company.
div3.closer:
E. E. Bouldin,
je 19--6t Captain Charlotte Cavalry.

div3.head: City Battalion — Major W. M. Elliott, commanding pay $31 per month and rations.
div3.p: one hundred men Wanted, between the ages of 16 and 45, for a company in the above battalion, for local and special defence of the city of Richmond or Manchester, for a term of six months, unless sooner discharged by order of the Secretary of War.
None but men of good character will be received.
div3.closer:
Apply, between the hours of 9 A. M. and 2 P. M. to W. W. Harrison,
at Ragland & Bro.'s, cor, 9th and Main sts.;
Geo. Baughman,
W. H. Allison,
121 Main street;
John M. West,
je 19--6t* 145 Main street.

div3.p:
A reward of Thirty Dollars will be paid for the arrest and safe delivery at Castle Godwin of Private William Dunn, aged 26 years, 5 feet 8 inches high, dark hair and eyes, fair complexion, and well proportioned; a native of Ireland, but for many years a resident of Hagerstown, in Maryland.
The said Wm. Dunn is a deserter from Company C. 12th Battalion Light Artillery.
div3.closer:
Capt. Jno. L. Eubank,
je 19--6t* Battery No. 7.

div3.head:
Attention!
Marylanders.
div3.p:
--I am authorized to recruit for the First Maryland Line, and start for headquarters (at Staunton,) positively next Tuesday morning. I have opened an office over D. H. Brotherton's store, corner of Main and 14th streets, for the reception and enrolling of Recruits.
There is no excuse for any Marylander longer.
Those who wish to see their native State and homes at an early day, guided by accomplished and gallant officers, have now the last opportunity offered.
div3.closer:
James Mullen.
je 19--4t* 1st Lieut. 1st Maryland Line.

div3.head: Thirty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--I will give the above reward for the arrest and delivery to me, at Battery No. 10, near Richmond, of Michael Kally, a private in my company.
Said Kally is about 5 feet 8 inches high, full dark beard, sharp features, and is by birth an Irishman.
div3.closer:
Charles R. Mcalpine,
je 19--3t* Captain Rebel Grays.

div3.head: To Colonels of regiments.
div3.p: --The services of a first-class Drummer, competent to instruct, can be had by addressing "X. Y. Z.," Staunton P. O., Staunton, Va.

div3.head:
Adjutant General's office,
Virginia, June 17th, 1862.
div3.p: Impressments.--Officers and persons authorized to recruit for the State Line are positively prohibited from impressments of horses, mules, or other property of private citizens, or interfering with it in any way whatever.
div3.closer:
By command:
je 18--3t Wm. H. Richardson, A. G.

div3.head:
Adjutant General's office,
June 16, 1862.
div3.p:
the several persons who have been authorized to recruit men for the Line of State Troops, under the provisions of the Act of Assembly of May 15, 1862, are required to discontinue recruiting in the city of Richmond immediately.
Recruits not yet inspected are to be presented at this office for inspection by or before the 18th inst., after which no subsistence or transportation will be allowed.
div3.closer:
By order of the Governor.
Wm. H. Richardson,
je 17--3t Adjutant General.

div3.head:
Adjutant General's office,
June 16, 1862.
div3.p: Major Wilkins, commanding the second class militia of the city of Richmond, will detain an officer and guard from his command, with orders to visit all stores and other places of mercantile business, which have not been or are not closed according to order at 2 o'clock P. M., and unless the proprietors shall conform promptly to that order, to place them under arrest and report.
All Apothecary stores are excepted.
div3.closer:
By command.
je 17--3t Wm. H. Richardson, A. G.

div3.head: Fifty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Fifty dollars will be paid for the delivery of my negro Kitt, who left camp May 18th. He is about 33 years old, 5 feet two or three inches high, high for head, with a scar on his under lip, black, smooth skin, heavy built, weighs about 160 pounds, is very bowlegged and pigeon-toed.
He is quite intelligent, and may pass with free papers for a Virginia negro.
He was born in Georgia; is probably hiring himself out as an officer's servant.
George P. Heard.
Capt. R. A. Hardaway's Light Battery,
Featherston's Brigade, D. H. Hill's Division,
je 20--7t* Four-mile post York River R. R.

div3.head: Ranaway.
div3.p:
--From the camp of the Mathews cavalry, near Seven Pines, last night, a negro Boy, about 18 years old, has a burned scar on the side of his face.
A liberal reward will be paid for the apprehension of him. His name is Ned.--The informant will address.
Serg't Wm. C. Diggs.
je 20--2t* Mathews Light Dragoons.

div3.head: Twenty Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--For any information that will lead to the recovery of my two Servants, Willis and Bill, who left "Liggon Hospital" on last Thursday evening. They may be making their way to Harrisonburg, the residence of my father.
W. Otho Hill,
Asst. Surgeon C. S. A., Battery No. 7.

div3.head: Ran away.
div3.p:
--From the American Hotel, on Monday, the 10th of June, a mulatto boy, named William, of middle size, about sixteen years old. He may be at some of the adjacent camps or within the Federal lines, having left the hotel with another boy of the same name, from Hanover county.
The boy was brought up in Petersburg, and has been hired at the American for two years. A suitable reward will be given for the apprehension and delivery of the said boy at the American Hotel, by the owner.
je 18--3t*

div3.head: Ranaway.
div3.p:
--From the subscriber, on the 15th inst., a Negro man named Ben, purchased some short time since of Mr. Stephen Page, of North Carolina.
Ben is black, about 32 years of age, over six feet high, has a good number of whip marks upon his person, and wore a trues at the time of his departure, he being raptured.
He is probably making his way, to North Carolina, where he has a wife.
I will give a reward of Twenty five Dollars for his arrest and delivery to me in Richmond, or for his confinement in call so that I get him again.
David McDaniel.

div3.head: Runaway.
div3.p:
--From my house, on Wednesday, June 11th, my Negro Boy, Ned: He is 13 years of age, 4 feet eight or ten inches high, and of a dark-brown complexion.
He is in some camp in or around Richmond.
A liberal reward will be given on his delivery.
Mrs. Robert Nott.
je 19--4t Cary and 3d street.

div3.head: Twenty-five Dollars reward.
div3.p:
--Left my house on Monday night 16th inst., a negro boy named Beverly, 18 years old about 3 feet 6 inches high black skin, white teeth, balls of eyes somewhat inflamed, thick of hearing.
Any one returning the said boy to me, or committing him in Richmond, will receive the above reward.
je 19--3t* James Milton Carter.
